title: Ticket #3788: [EC2] EC2 security group list should be pipe-separated
description:
According to

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-network-security.html

we can't use commas to separate security groups because they're a legal character in (some) security group names. Because spaces are as well (?!), we should change the list separator to a pipe before somebody gets bitten by this.

This will require changing the gahp client to call escapeGahpString() on each security group name.
remarks:
2013-Nov-07 16:58:54 by tlmiller:
EC2 "classic" security group names are restricted to "ASCII characters". Testing indicates that Amazon ignores leading and trailing whitespace (convenient, since StringList does as well), but that will mean it's not simple to allow arbitrary security group names without doing something like "+SecurityGroupName_1 = foo |, ]" as the interface, which is distressing. Reducing to priority 5 until someone actually complains about it.

2013-Nov-10 21:09:45 by bbockelm:
What about ClassAd lists?

2013-Nov-11 10:05:32 by tlmiller:
What about ClassAd lists?

A good idea, and probably the least-awful of our options, but since the submit file syntax is not ClassAd, I'm a little wary of just declaring it to be that simple.
